remarks.format: ## Remarks 控件都将引发单击排序按钮时，之前的事件控件处理排序操作。The control raises the event when a Sort button is clicked, but before the control handles the sort operation. (一个排序按钮是一个按钮其`CommandName`属性设置为"排序"。)这使你能够执行自定义的例程，每次此事件发生时，例如自定义排序表达式的事件处理方法。(A Sort button is a button whose `CommandName` property set to "Sort".) This enables you to provide an event-handling method that performs a custom routine whenever this event occurs, such as customizing the sort expression. A对象传递给事件处理方法。A object is passed to the event-handling method. 此对象，可指定或确定的排序表达式和排序方向控件。This object enables you to specify or determine the sort expression and sort direction for the control. 若要确定排序表达式，请使用属性。To determine the sort expression, use the property. 若要确定排序方向，使用属性。To determine the sort direction, use the property. 此外可以通过设置取消排序操作属性`true`。You can also cancel a sorting operation by setting the property to `true`. 有关 类的实例的初始属性值列表，请参见 构造函数。For a list of initial property values for an instance of the class, see the constructor. ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何使用对象的排序方向和正在排序的列中显示。The following example shows how to use the object to display the sort direction and the column that is being sorted. remarks.format: ## Remarks 当引发事件，则可以使用属性指定将用于进行排序的排序表达式控件。When the event is raised, you can use the property to specify the sort expression that will be used to sort the control. 排序表达式包含要排序的字段的名称。The sort expression contains the name of the field to sort. 通过以编程方式将此属性设置为逗号分隔的字段名称列表，也可以进行多个列排序一次。You can also sort multiple columns at a time by programmatically setting this property to a comma-separated list of field names. > [!NOTE] > 默认情况下，控件适用于列的完整列表的排序方向。By default, the control applies the sort direction to the complete list of columns. 因此，排序方向适用于仅在列表中的最后一列。As a result, the sort direction applies to only the last column in the list. ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何使用对象的排序方向和正在排序的列中显示。The following example shows how to use the object to display the sort direction and the column being sorted. 此代码示例摘自更大的示例为提供类。This code example is part of a larger example provided for the class.
